title: Condensate Drain Sizing
description: AC Drain Wiz must be installed in a system that follows proper drain sizing based on equipment output.
complianceNotes: The AC Drain Wiz system is designed to work within standard condensate drain sizing requirements. The 3/4" NPT connection accommodates most residential AC unit drain requirements.

title: Drain Pipe Materials and Installation
description: AC Drain Wiz connects to condensate piping and must be compatible with approved materials (PVC, CPVC, copper, etc.).
complianceNotes: AC Drain Wiz is constructed from UV-resistant ABS plastic with 3/4" NPT connections, making it compatible with standard PVC, CPVC, and copper condensate drain systems.

title: Auxiliary Drain Pan
description: While AC Drain Wiz proactively clears blockages, code still requires auxiliary pans or switches if overflow could cause damage.
complianceNotes: AC Drain Wiz reduces the likelihood of overflow, but auxiliary drain pans or float switches may still be required in areas where water damage could occur. The AC Drain Wiz Sensor can serve as an auxiliary drain switch.

title: Auxiliary Drain Systems
description: Drain Wiz can be used in tandem with auxiliary drain switches (like float switches) for added protection.
complianceNotes: AC Drain Wiz works in conjunction with auxiliary drain systems. The AC Drain Wiz Sensor provides smart monitoring capabilities that can integrate with existing float switch systems.

title: Condensate Disposal
description: Residential code requirements for condensate disposal systems.
complianceNotes: AC Drain Wiz systems comply with residential condensate disposal requirements and can be installed in accordance with IRC M1411 guidelines.
